metadata.title: CVE-2016-5240 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The DrawDashPolygon function in magick/render.c in GraphicsMagick before1.3.24 and the SVG renderer in ImageMagick allow remote attackers to causea denial of service (infinite loop) by converting a circularly defined SVGfile.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5240` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.24-1
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.24-1
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.24-1
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.24-1
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.24-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.24-1').
